medium: Pen and brown ink, brown wash, black chalk
creditline: Bequest of Dan Fellows Platt, Class of 1895
markings:
Stamp in black, verso, lower left: [circle with initials D.F.P.] [Lugt 750a]
Stamp in blue, verso, lower left: [dimond with P] [Lugt 2066b]
inscribed:
In graphite, verso, lower left: H-61 [with X above in red pencil] Girolamo Mazzola Bedoli | attr School of Parma [in Platt hand]
In graphite, verso, lower center: Meatyard | 1925 [in Platt hand]
In purple ink, verso, lower right: L N 48
In black ink, verso, upper center: Da  5

makers.displaymaker: formerly attributed to Charles de La Traverse, French, ca. 1726–ca. 1780

texts.remarks: As per Giada Damen, IMLS Drawings 2018-2020

bibliography.boilertext: Barbara T. Ross, "Notes on selected French old master drawings from the permanent collection," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 42, no. 1 (1983): p. 4-42.
bibliography.citation: Barbara T. Ross, "Notes on selected French old master drawings from the permanent collection," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 42, no. 1 (1983): p. 4-42., p. 24 (illus.)

bibliography.boilertext: "Sixteenth-to eighteenth-century French drawings from the permanent collection: a checklist of the exhibition," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 42, no. 1 (1983): p. 43-49.
bibliography.citation: "Sixteenth-to eighteenth-century French drawings from the permanent collection: a checklist of the exhibition," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 42, no. 1 (1983): p. 43-49., p. 46

displaymaker: attributed Etienne de Lavallée, French, 1735–1802 | formerly attributed to Charles de La Traverse, French, ca. 1726–ca. 1780
caption: Attributed Etienne de Lavallée (French, 1735–1802), formerly attributed to Charles de La Traverse (French, ca. 1726–ca. 1780), Woman teaching a child. Pen and brown ink, brown wash, black chalk; 22.7 x 15.1 cm. Bequest of Dan Fellows Platt, Class of 1895 (x1948-604)
